title: Would an 820-3536 board (2013 retina MacBook Pro) work without a hall sensor?
message:
Hey guys

So I bought a liquid damaged MacBook Pro on eBay. Originally it had no 3V42 but after I fixed that I noticed that the display would flicker. 
This Mac isn't intended for resale, I just need a Mac. Would the board work as expected if I were to remove the hall sensor with the exception of turning the screen off when you close the lid? I don't have any donor boards and I don't want to wait for Chinese shipping. The sensor looked pretty terrible so I have a feeling that's whats bad. Thanks!

title: Would an 820-3536 board (2013 retina MacBook Pro) work without a hall sensor?
message:
Apart of no reaction from lid, machine will work good.
But easy to check if SMC_LID signal fluctuates.
You could have problems with backlight circuit instead.
